metadata.name: Suspicious Usage Of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
metadata.comment: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe to perform different actions such as restoring snapshots...etc.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\ntdsutil.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('ntdsutil.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('snapshot')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('mount ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ac')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' i')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ntds')))

output.summary: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe to perform different actions such as restoring snapshots...etc.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate usage to restore snapshots 2. Legitimate admin activity References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-server-2012-r2-and-2012/cc731620(v=ws.11), https://symantec-enterprise-blogs.security.com/blogs/threat-intelligence/espionage-asia-governments
